data.title: Arch of Hadrian (Hadrian's Gate), Athens, Greece
data.meta_description: The Arch of Hadrian, also known as Hadrian's Gate, was built in Athens to honor the Roman Emperor Hadrian and his contributions to the city. It stands at the entrance of Jerash and offers a glimpse into the grandeur of Rome. The arch is made of marble from Mountain Penteli, located 18km away, just like its neighboring Temple of Olympian Zeus. Inscriptions on both sides commemorate Athens and Hadrian.
